abstract.shortdesc: Various installation options that are available with

section.p: This section describes various installation options that are available with . Irrespective of any option that you select, to install successfully, you need to perform three important steps. Failure to follow these recommendations will likely compromise reliability and performance:

p.note:
(READ THIS FIRST)
STEP 1 - Download the installation packages.
STEP 2 - You need to apply a Horizon Bundle for installing the cloud. For more information on STEP 1 and STEP 2, refer to the cloud installation section.
STEP 3 - To complete the installation, follow the instructions in the installation guides given below:
installation for CPE systemsThis document provides information and instructions for installing and configuring for CPE systems (Customer Premises Equipment). CPE is intended for small applications only. It runs on two physical nodes. Each node provides both the controller and compute functions.
Reference Link- installation for cpe systems
installation for systems with controller storage
This document provides information and instructions for installing configurations for controller storage systems that are initially deployed using LVM-backed block storage on controller nodes. The uses two controller nodes and (n) compute nodes (minimum two recommended for redundancy). Persistent storage for VMs is implemented on the controller nodes.
Reference Link - installation for systems with controller storage
installation for systems with dedicated storage
This document provides information and instructions for installing and configuring for dedicated storage systems that uses two controller nodes, (n) compute nodes, and a storage cluster consisting of up to eight storage nodes (paired for redundancy). Persistent storage for VMs is implemented on the storage cluster, offering greater scalability.
Reference Link - installation for systems with dedicated storage
for regions
This document provides installation and configuration information for deploying in any of the supported Regions configurations.
Reference Link - for regions
